result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth V Pearson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 7 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: Revocation

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. Any prescription must be taken as prescribed. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment and or schooling. 15 hours community service each week the defendant is not in school or working. No contact with any know drug dealers or users. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth V Pearson

records.addlTxt:
11:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kenneth V Pearson appeared by video, in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Kenneth V Pearson. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant waives right to appear in person. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - Cts 1, 2, 3 & 4- GUILTY. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: Cts 1, 2, 3 & 4 GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in. Parties waive PSI and wish to go forward with sentencing today. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 
Defendant gives statement. 

BTC: 
Ct 1-
7 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 3.5 years initial confinement with 3.5 years extended supervision on each count concurrent to each other but consecutive to revocation. 

Conditions of extended supervision:
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be
monitored accordingly. Any prescription must be taken as prescribed. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
15 hours community service for each week the defendant is not in school or working.
No contact with drug dealers or users. 
Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. 
Firearm warning.
Voting warning.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

Defendant is not eligible for CIP
Defendant is eligible for SAP.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

to transport deft from Dodge Correctional for PH 04-07-2022
emailed to RASO 02-28-2022; 4:12 pm -CANCELED 04/01/22 TO BE SCHEDULED FOR ZOOM

8:51 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kenneth V Pearson appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared in court for Kenneth V Pearson. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense requests adjournment. Defense requests defendant to appear via zoom once transferred to dodge.
BTC: Matter adjourned. Finding of good cause to waive time limits. Defendant can appear via zoom if it is a waiver, state to do an ott if it will be a contested hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kenneth V Pearson appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Sophia Dolan appeared by video for Kenneth V Pearson. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
BTC: Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Initial appearance on February 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
